choices: Iris (The Chosen One)
Sapphire (the blue-she dragon)
Magnius (the wandering swordsman)
Blaze (Sapphire's older brother)
1.content:
Deep in the abandoned mines of Coran a mysterious figure approaches a large emblem on the ground. A shadow floats up from the center and the figure says
         "The country suspects nothing my lord Draven and they have no idea that I am slowly bringing you back."
         "The magic users will catch on and send their chosen one."
         "Worry not my lord my organization shall take care of her."
         "They'd better, for your sake." says the shadow. The black mist then vanishes and leaves the man alone.
1.title: Intro

choices: You go and pack your things
You go and find Sapphire first
11.content:
The day you had always feared was now apon you. The Archwizard at the temple had a vision the other night, a vision filled with shadow. Now here you are at the meeting of the council to determine what to make of it.
         "There's no proof that this vision indicates Draven's return!" Shouted one of the elders
         "The Archwizard is never wrong and by the look in his eyes there is no way to avoid this fate, save for The Chosen one." says another as he motions to you
         "She is not nearly old enough to face such a terror."
         "The orginal Chosen One was even younger than she is when he vanquished this same threat."
         "She doesn't have the proper training and-"
         "Enough!" shouts the Archwizard from his center chair, "This evil has been unleashed upon our land and I have no doubt of that. Now is the time for the chosen one to preform her duty." he says. To this you stand up bravely and say
         "I am ready to do my part in protecting this world."
         "Then it is decided, you and Sapphire must set out at once to clense the world of this shadow. Get your things ready and may the gods watch over you." Says the Archwizard.
11.title: Iris

choices: You can ignore the village and continue on to Krix
You could try to help the village anyway.
111.content:
Without a word you bow respectfully to the elders and exited the royal meeting hall. The Archwizard then addressed one of the high servants. "Galgion, take her to Sapphire. Iris, you travel on dragon back to the city of Krix. There will you be given something to aid you in your quest."

Iris was about to ask what it could be that was so important then held her tongue. Galgion the high servant led her to a high and broad tower top. You are over whelmed by the sight before you.

"Haven't you ever seen a dragon before?"said Galgion.

"Yes, but never close. She's so beautiful and majestic, " you say.

"Thanks Iris. You're an exceptional young human yourself." The voice that spoke was a like the sound of a lovely horn. It was gentle but it still had the presence of power.

"Thank you. I was told that you were to take me to Krix to obtain an object, "you say.

"The talisman we seek is called the Heart of Nethaal. It is a jewel that was forged through magic by the best human and dragon magic users of the time a thousand years ago. Nethaal was the name of the dragon and the human was Grifith. It is said that Nethaal drained all of his magic into an old emerald, " said Sapphire.

"How will we find it? Krix is so vast," you say.

"What we seek are looking for is not in Krix. We are merely being sent to get information concerning its' whereabouts."

"Who are we looking for?" you ask.

"A monk named Nephelius. He is the oldest dragon partner in the known land. He is quite lonely and bitter because his dragon was slain by Draven before he was sealed away by the last chosen one, "said Sapphire

"That was three hundred years ago. How could he still be alive?" you say.

"Nethaal and Grifith took magic to it's boundaries. They created a spell to give them long life for a thousand years. They might have just been the greatest there was. That's why we are seeing him. His knowledge of magic and time given wisdom is uncanny, " Sapphire said. "Enough talk. I would first start with learning to channel magic, but finding Grifith is of more importance."

Sapphire let down her left wing so you could climb on her back. Somehow you are totally trusting of the creature and you comfortably mount your dragon partner. You burst into the air at full speed as your blond hair is blown back. Then as you continue to soar in the sky you notice a large village on fire. In the flame and smoke you are able to make out a great multitude of men on horseback coming down to the valley where the village is.

"We have to help them!" you cry.

"There are thousands of them. I can't kill them all. We have to keep going, " Sapphire says.
111.title: You go and pack your things

choices: Ride towards the square
Follow after the man
1112.content:
"Please, we're the only ones who can help!" you yell.

Sapphire looked down and assessed the situation. "There's one thing we could do. I can just try to scare them away. Hold on I'm going down,"Sapphire says to you. She makes a step dive over the bands of men and roars as she spews out flames. About twenty of them were incinerated while others start to retreat out of the valley from where the village is. Sapphire swooped back up to make another pass at the bandits. The men tried to attack your dragon with spears and arrows, but her strong scales repelled the flying weapons. After the men saw their partners burned to death and realized they couldn't kill her, the rest of the men joined the others who had fled.

"There on the run Sapphire! You did it!" you say with glee.

"it's a good thing this didn't take to long. I was getting tired," Sapphire says.

You look down at the villagers who are waving at you with smiles. Then you continue on your quest. You fly over beautiful land below. The tops of trees make picturesque forest canopies as you see birds flying above them. Soon you find yourself soaring above majestic mountains together with deep canyons. You make out rivers that run through them that pour into shimmering waterfalls. Ahead of you a city outskirt comes into view.

"That is the city of Bain, where many travelers pass through every day. Nethaal lives in one of the forest temples in the Western highlands. Most of them are very remote. There are a collection of people called The Order of The Twilight. They have more knowledge of the secret places of Krix. You'll find them in the Central Cathedral in the city square. I'll stay out of sight in the border of Bain while you go to the Cathedral. It is along way to the square, so you'll need to rent a horse, " Sapphire says.

Your dragon lands just outside the city border. "I'll be back as soon as I can," you say. You make your way through the city entrance into a crowd of people bustling about. You immediately see a horse stall and pay an overweight stout man with a white beard. "You can have five hours with her. She's a top the line breed. None faster or smoother riding, " the man says.

Just as you are about to mount the horse, you see a man with malevolent eyes staring at you from about seven yards away. The look on his face was cold and austere. After a few moments he started walk away slowly as if he were waiting for you to follow.
1112.title: You could try to help the village anyway.

choices: The Archwizard comes out to give you instructions
You already know your task and head out
112.content:
As you exit the meeting you run out across the court yard towards your best friend, Sapphire. You find her where se usually is this early, sleeping on her back in your room. You run over and jump on her belly and she awakes with a start,
         "Wah! W-what's going on!" she says as she jerks her head around. She then looks down and sees you, "Oh, it's you. Don't scare me like that I could've lit the whole bedroom on fire." she says.
         "Sapphire, we... we have to go."
         "What? Why?"
         "The Archwizard has had a vision that Draven is returning."
         "What!? That's... not good."
         "You're telling me, now get up you lazy bag of scales we have to pack."
         "You know I don't like it when you call me that, right?"
         "Yes." you respond. She sighs and you jump off her belly as she stands and yawns, showing her cavernous maw and razor sharp teeth. "Ugh, your breath stinks!" you say, she mearly rolls her eyes and stretches. You run over to your dresser and pull out clothes that you need for the trip and set them on your bed. You then grab Saphire's saddle of the wall and pack your things in the pouches. "There, all done." you say as you attach your sword to the saddle as well. "Alright lets get this on you." you say
         "Give me a second." Sapphire says as she finishes stretching. The morning sunlight filtering through the window reflects off her scales and casts blue lights all over the room. You quickly throw the saddle over her back and slide under her belly to attach the straps together. "We're leaving so soon?" Saphire says as you connect the saddle straps,
         "Yes, saving the world is like a priority or something, now hold still." you say as you finish and climb out from under her, "Lets go grab some food for the trip."
         "I thought you'd never ask." Saphire says. The two of you jog back outside and head over to the cafeteria where a few other dragons and magic users are heading as well. The two of you rush inside and head to the kitchen, "Hey we're here to collect our provisions for our journey." you tell the chef, Sapphire then clears her throat and looks at you. "Oh, and we also need breakfast."
         "Getting a rather early start now aren't ya?" the chef says "Alight, there's some meat over there in the corner for you Sapphire and I'll see what I canget for you Iris." the chef says as he walks off. Sapphire immediatly pounces on the pile of meat and begins to devour it,
         "You act like you haven't eaten in days." you say
         "Rule 38; never go flying on an empty stomach."
         "You made that up."
         "So?" she responds, the chef then walks out with a plate of eggs and bacon for you,
         "The provisions you need are out back when your done." he says. You quickly scarf down your meal and head outside,
         "Come on Sapphire!" you say as she finishes eating. She follows you out back and the two of you look at the supplies which consisted of mainly food and a few bottled drinks. All of the things are in packaged crates and sealed with magic so no amunt of rocking or twisting would smash the food "Great, everything we need is here. Sapphire if you would." you say, Sapphire then walks over and begins swallowing the supllies whole and sending them down to her storrage stomach. "It's real handy that dragons have stomachs with the specific purpose of storing items and keeping them fresh." you say. Once she finishes the two of you walk over to the well, "Sapphire?"
         "Yeah yeah I got it." she says as she begins guzzling water. The water then flows down her throat into her water stomach that has the purpose of storing and purifying water for trips. "Alright, I think that's everything." she says as she finishes,
         "Alright, lets head out." you say
112.title: Preparation

choices: Sapphire informs you the wind is too strong and she'll have to land
Sapphire powers through the wind and the rain
1121.content:
"Wait just a moment." the Archwizard says as he approaches you, "As you know your path is to go to all four cities in the land and drink from each fountain." he continues, "Their magic will make you strong enough to destroy Draven for good."
         "I thought Coran was abandoned and in ruins." you respond
         "It is, this will make your task of finding the spring harder but you can do it. Remember, your magic can save you if you get in trouble, good luck." he says with a reassuring smile.
         "Alright Iris, it's time for us to go." Sapphire tells you as she strides toward the exit.
         "Thanks for everything! See you later!" you say to the Archwizard as Sapphire walks off with you on her back. You exit the courtyard and come to the edge of a massive cliff and the sun is high above you. Down below you can see clouds that don't reach the top of the mountain and hide the ground from sight. You take a deep breath as Sapphire spreads her wings and leaps off the cliff. You're glad that you're attached to the saddle because Sapphire is in a massive nose dive and is headed straight for the clouds. You utter a quick water resistant spell before you go through the clouds covering an hold on tightly to Sapphire's neck as she passes through the clouds. You can't see a thing through the thick clouds and hope they break soon lest Sapphire falls too close to the ground. The clouds thin out and you can see the ground below and realize the clouds are releasing rain and covering everything with water. Your water resisting spell keeps you nice and dry though and Sapphire starts off towards the first city, Seafare. Meanwhile down below on the ground a man in a black cloak watches the two of you head off in the direction of your destiny.
1121.title: Farewells

choices: Fly over head and look for the four locations from the sky
Look for the hidden location in the darkness of the forest.
1122.content:
"The first thing we do is travel the ruins of Coran in the Southern mountains. That's where Draven was sealed into the realm of the Abyss," you say.

"You're forgetting something Iris. The southern ruins are vast. We just can't go searching for something where don't have a general idea. It would be like a needle in a haystack. I wish we had crystal ball right about now,"Sapphire says.

Oh... that's right. Don't worry, with the two of us together we'll make it through this," you say

"You're right as rain Iris. I can feel the courage welling up inside me. No wait, that's just indigestion. I think I've over ate a bit. Don't worry I haven't digested the supplies."

You chuckle at your special friend. "You always were good at jokes. There's no fool in all the three Kingdoms that's better than you," you say.

"Thanks Iris. You're quite the audience yourself. I've never known you to be a tough crowd. Now then, the first thing we to do is ask around. We'll start by traveling to Dram. There are mystics that live there that are very wise and possess historical scrolls over a thousand years old."

"Whatever you say Sapphire. I trust your judgment," you say.

"Okay, hop on and let's get this show on the road," Sapphire says. You sit on the saddle and fly off towards the east for the forest lands. Sapphire soars majestically with her beautiful wings and powerful chest. You look down and notice a lake that danced with the reflection of a purple setting sun. You feel free and exhilarated as the dew touches your face. Then a tree lined shore comes into view ahead of you.

"I see it! I see the forest!"

"Whoa there little siren. We still have to find the mystics first. It will be a little hard to find them. They are not a sedentary people,"Sapphire says.

"Sedentary? What does that mean?"

"They don't like to roost in one place for very long," Sapphire says.

"Alright, so how do we find them?"

"There are five locations that they annually migrate to within the forest. We have to check each one. Their are four of these locations
that can be seen from above. The last one is concealed in thick tree tops that shields light from hitting the bottom floor,"

"It's a good thing dragons have good night seeing. So where do we search first?" you ask.
1122.title: You already know your task and head out

choices: You go with Iris to help her pack
You wait for her at the exit
12.content:
'I wonder how long Iris will be in that meeting.' you think to yourself. This meeting had been rather sudden and Iris had been called into it right in the middle of your game of tag. You can't believe haw good she is a that game considering how much bigger and faster you are than her. She finally comes out and you run over to her, "What was that about?" you ask
         "The day we have always feared is apon us, Draven is coming back."
         "What!? Are you sure?" you say
         "Yes We've got to go pack our things." Iris says, the two of you then head to your rooms,
         'I guess it's time to see if all our training has paid off.' you think to yourself.
12.title: Sapphire

choices: You fly for a while longer
You decide to land at the nearby dragon camp, where Sapphire's brother is
122.content:
"I'll go get food and water for the trip, then meet you by the exit." you say
         "Alright, but be quick." Iris responds as she runs off. You head over to the kitchen and see food supplies all set out. You start swallowing them whole and they fall down your throat to your storage stomach.
         "There, that should keep them fresh." you say to yourself when you finish. You then briskly walk to the well and begin guzzling water which falls down into your water stomach. You pull your head out of the well when you finish filling your water stomach, you then walk over to the exit of the temple and wait. Snow falls from the sky outside and paints the world white. You stick you tongue out to catch the flakes but they melt from the hotness of your breath before they reach the pink flesh.
         "Hey I got your saddle!" yells Iris as she runs to you, when she reaches you the two of you stop for a moment and look outside. Memories of when the two of you were young kick in and it makes you smile. Iris reaches up and strokes your jaw-line, "It'll be okay, we'll do great." she says
         "Oh I'm not worried about us, I'm worried for Draven when I get my claws on him." you respond. Iris laughs and attaches your saddle, "Guess we're of then." you state as you walk to the edge of the cliff. The entire temple is built on an outcropping near the mountain top, if it weren't for the snow clouds you'd be able to see the whole world from here. "Here we go." you take a deep breath and leap over the edge. Wind blasts in your face and Iris clings tightly around your neck as you descend to the ground. "I'll level out as soon as we break through the clouds!" you shout above the wind. Soon enough the clouds break and you can see the sun and you level out.
122.title: The Quest Begins

choices: "He just went hunting, he'll be back soon."
"He's sleeping in his bed over there."
1222.content:
As you fly over the woodland area a thought occurs to you.
         "Why don't we go find my brother? He could probably help us." you say
         "What? You don't think we can do this alone?" Iris responds sarcastically,
         "We need all the help we can get and I haven't seen Blaze in forever."
         "Okay, lets go." Iris says. You change your course just slightly and head towards your brother's camp. The camp comes into sight rather quickly and you begin to descend. Dragons turn and watch as the two of you approach and land in the camp.
         "Sapphire, what are you doing here?" one of the dragons asks,
         "I'm looking for my brother, have you seen him?" You reply. The other dragon nods and responds...
1222.title: Blaze

choices: You decide to leave right now
The dragons offer you all a meal berfore you leave
12222.content:
"Alright, thanks." You respond. You walk over to the cave that the dragon directed you to. Inside, you can hear a extremely loud snoring noise. "That's my brother." You say to Iris who is still on your back. You step inside and sneak over to your brother, Blaze. You put your head down close to his head and roar as loud as you can.
         "WAH! W-wazzit?" He says as he jumps up and looks around.
         "Hahaha! That was hilarious! You should've seen your face!" You laugh,
         "Wow, sis what're you doing here?" He asks,
         "We came to get you for a very important mission." Iris informs your brother.
         "Ah, so it's the whole 'fate of the world' thing isn't it?" He asks, "Okay, lets get this over with." He says as he stands and stretches his back.
12222.title: "He's sleeping in his bed over there."

choices: You ask what they're doing all the way out here
You start to walk away and the girl calls after you
The blue dragon tackles you and demands to know why you're here
13.content:
You trudge along the road to Seafare. Everything is silent, save for your thoughts. There has been rumors whispered in the dark and an unforeseen evil seems to be rising. Not that you care, you've never believed in that third sense ability people think they have about danger. You deal with the problem when it's in front of you. You hear a shriek in the woods to the right and notice that something, or somethings, that are really big must have fought through here. There are many broken trees and Griffin feathers all around. You hear the the shriek again, this time followed by a loud roar, and dash off in its direction. When you arrive you see three Griffins surrounding a girl and two dragons. You pull out your massive sword and leap down there.
         "You three gonna back off?" You say to the Griffins, knowing they can't understand you. The three turn and one of them dashes toward you with its beak open. You side step and bring your sword down on its decapitate it. The other two turn and decide you're the bigger threat, they then begin to circle you menacingly. As they leap you continuously counter them until eventually they make a mistake. One of them attacks you head-on, you swipe the broad side of your across the creature's face and then lift up your blade, bring it down, and smash the animal's skull. Blood sprays your face and you turn and look at the final Griffin which has run off in fear.
         "I would've had them soon enough." The red male dragon says
          "Whatever you say." You respond as you wipe the blood off your face.
13.title: Magnius

choices: "No thanks, girlie; I'm not your babysitter."
"Yeah, sure, I feel awful generous today."
"Reward?  How much?"
132.content:
"Wait!" she cries after you.
         You roll your eyes and turn back around to face that small, girlish voice. "What?" you snarl. The girl matches the voice: petite, bright eyes, and young. So very young. You turn your attention to her dragon companions, the red male and blue female. They both glare at you suspiciously. Well, who doesn't?
         "That was very brave of you, sir." The girl touches your arm with a sweet smile, the voice dripping with wonder and awe. "My name is Iris, and my friends are--"
         You shrug away, "Yes, eternally grateful, I'm sure." You try to turn away again, but those eyes! Iris stops you dead in your tracks with another friendly touch. "What do you want?"
         "I just wanted to thank you," Iris whimpered. Like everyone else, she recoiled from you. "Because you didn't have to--"
         "That's right, I didn't have to save you and your sorry lizard friends." You turn around, but, somehow, the blue dragon has managed to block your path. She growls at you. "What, scaly?"
         "We could have gotten along without you, you know," the blue she-dragon roars in your face. You are unfazed as she raises a clawed foot to your sword. "If you knew who she was, you wouldn't dare threaten Iris."
         "Sapphire!" Iris cries. "He helped us. You saw him against those Griffins!"
         "But we didn't need it," Sapphire grumbles. But she still retreated into a defensive crouch, glaring daggers at you.
         "Still," Iris counters. She looks at you again, but this time, you can't pull away again. "You must be a knight. Sir--?"
         "Magnius. No fancy title, no fancy clothes. Just Magnius," you say. Then you stop yourself. What was so different about this little girl that you decide to open up to her? Next thing you know, you two will be weeping and sharing secrets, so you clam up.
         "Magnius." Does she ever stop smiling? "Magnius, we already owe you for killing those Griffins. You seem like a good man, worthy of knighthood. Would your consider accompanying us on our quest."
         "NO!" Sapphire roars behind you. You feel her smoking breath on the back of your neck.
         The red dragon growls, too. "I wouldn't trust him, either, Iris." He took a great whiff. "He seems particularly dark."
         What, can dragons sense those sort of things? "I thought you didn't need me anyways," you shrug. But they have you cornered, between the simpering smile and two growling dragons. "Seems like your lizard friends have you well taken care of."
         "We might need you!" Iris pleads. "We're on an important mission. And I'm sure that, when we're done, you shall find the reward favorable."
         You pause, staring deep into her shining, young eyes and bright, captivating smile. You take a deep breath and say,
132.title: You start to walk away and the girl calls after...

choices: Draw your sword and kill your attackers
Look for cover, every man for himself
Protect the girl
1323.content:
"Reward?" you ask, suddenly intrigued by the smiling girl and her companions. "How much?"
"I thought that might get your attention," Iris said with a girlish smile and a twirl of her hair. "Let's just say. . . I have powerful connections." She paused, smiling. "Are you in?"
"Here's the thing. . ." you say, skeptically. "I sure as hell am not your babysitter." She looked offended by your choice of words -- which was exactly the effect you had wanted. "I'm not just going to jump into this unless there's something in it for me. Something guaranteed."
"She's not going to tell you anything until I know that we can trust you," growled Sapphire.
Iris laughed as she patted the dragon on the neck lovingly, "If that were true, we'd never get to tell him anything."
You momentarily admire the obvious relationship between the travelers, but shake off the feeling quickly. "I don't have all day, so you better convince me quickly. I have important matters to attend to elsewhere."
Iris' eyes glisten with a silent laughter at your seriousness. Why does she find everything about you so humorous? Your heart hardens a bit at the ignorant child, but you can't quite figure out why she affects you so much.
Suddenly, you hear the twang of a bow and the screech of a dragon -- Blaze has been struck by an arrow. The world spins for a moment in a dizzying wave of commotion, but you steady yourself and try to take in as much information as you can. Another arrow whizzes past, narrowly missing the girl. It's an ambush.

Your first instinct is to:
1323.title: Ambushed.

choices: "Why were they after you?"
"I don't have time for this."
13233.content:
You draw your sword and create a barrier between Iris and the rest of the world. Two more arrows follow, one barely missing Sapphire, the other lodging itself in your leg. You kneel over in pain and just manage to bring up your blade to block another bolt. When you gather your wits you immediately look around for Iris, but she's already at work removing the arrow from Blaze's wing. In what seems like no time, she has Blaze and Sapphire out of range of the shots, and is back by your side dislodging the arrow in your leg. The shots are cut short as Sapphire begins to unleash a torrent of fire in their direction. Any men who aren't burnt to a crisp begin to flee into the woods.
         You wince at the pain, but are sure to hide most of it from the girl. She leads to where the dragons now lay.
         "Are you okay?" She asks.
         "Fine," you reply. "Who were they shooting at?"
         "Me."
         You don't know what you've gotten yourself into.
         The next thing you say to Iris is:
13233.title: Protect the girl

choices: You start heading for the northern kingdom
It's getting dark and you stop for the night
132331.content:
"Why were those men attacking you?" you ask the girl,
         "That's none of your concern." Sapphire snaps at you,
         "The question wasn't directed to you." you respond to the she-dragon.
         "I am what they call the Chosen One. I am going from city to city in order to obtain the powers to defeat the demon king; Draven." Iris informs you.
         'Great, I got myself wrapped up in one of those 'end of the world' deals' you think to yourself. "Alright." you say, "I'll help you. I may not like it, but demon kings put a damper on staying alive."
         "Alright you can come with us." Iris says,
         "Wait! Shouldn't we discuss this?" Sapphire asks,
         "Sapphire, he's already helped us twice now and we need all the help we can get." Iris says. Sapphire growls disgruntledly and Blaze just shrugs.
132331.title: "Why were they after you?"

choices: You look up to see... your SISTER?!
She doesn't show up yet
14.content: "Finally." You think to yourself as you perch over a large cliff. After a long day of work you finally get to spread your wings and fly. The sun shines down from above as you slowly stretch your wings skyward and prepare to jump. For a moment the world is still and quiet. Then, you leap forward and head into a massive dive. The planet spins around you as you barrel-roll to the ground and you laugh as you do. At the last moment you turn up and fly up with your wings outstretched. "The world would be so much more peaceful if everyone could live like this." you think out loud
14.title: Blaze

choices: You make it to Seafare without any complications
Things just got complicated
141.content:
You gaze up at the mountain where your sister trains with her human companion. A large cloud covers the the mountain top, obscuring it from sight.
         "Wonder how she is doing." you think to yourself. As you look closer you see something emerge from the clouds and squint you your eyes to get a better view. "What the... Is that?" you say, it looks like a blue bird but the wings are wrong. " Lets get a closer look." you say as you fly towards it. As you approach you notice it looks like a blue dragon and kind of like... your SISTER?! "But she's supposed to be training." you say, as she nears you call out "Saphire!"
         "Blaze?!" she yells "What're you doing here?"
         "I might ask you the same question."
         "We are off to..." she looks around,
         "Oh come on, who could possibly hear us up here?"
         "...The Demon King, Draven, is rising and we're of to silence him." she says as she motions to her back. For the first time you notice a human on your sister's back. "This is my friend; Iris. Iris this is my brother; Blaze."
         "Charmed." you say
         "It's good to finally meet you." she responds
         "Well then, where to first?" you ask
         "Wait, you're coming?" Sapphire asks
         "Of course, I would never let my little sister face something like this without me."
         "You know I hate it when you talk to me like that, I'm only a little younger than you." she says, you laugh and respond,
         "Just like old times."
141.title: This is Unexpected

choices: You wake up in the morning
You wake up sooner and head out to the bar/lounge area
1411.content:
The three of you continue your journey across the forest, you can see the sun descending into the water as you approach th ocean.
         "There it is! Seafare!" Iris shouts out, sure enough a small city on the edge of the sea is now in sight. You begin to slowly decend from the sky and land in a nearby forest.
         "Well lets go." you say as the three of you start walking. Iris jumps off of Sapphire's back and walks between you and Sapphire. You near the city gates and the guard who is posted there begins to pale at the sight of two dragons.
         "A-A-Ah... what's y-y-your business here?" he asks
         "We're here to stay the night and head out in the morning." Sapphire says
         "Oh," you can clearly see the relief on the man's face "We don't get dragons here very often, well come on in. There's a nice inn called The Dragon's Nest down by the ocean front with dragon sized rooms if you're lookin to stay the night." the man suggests as he opens the gate.
         "Thanks." Sapphire replies as you step in. Inside the city is rather large consisting of many shops and homes varying from two to one story high. The town streets are mostly empty on account of how late it is and only a few people walk around the area. The crashing of waves can be heard in the distance and the stars are now beginning to appear in the sky. "It's late, we should head for the inn Iris is very tired." Sapphire says
         "But I need to get to the-" Iris is interupted by a yawn and quickly covers her mouth.
         "Sapphire is right Iris, we don't know where the spring is and we need to rest. We can go find out where it is first thing in the morning." you state, Iris finally agrees and the three of you continue onwards. "Hey do you know where we can find The Dragon's Nest inn?" you call out to a man passing by. He looks at you slightly surprised and says, "Head down this street, take a left, then take the very next left after that, you can't miss it." he says and quickly continues on.
         "Thanks." you shout out, you follow the man's directions and sure enough the inn is right where he said it would be. Some music can be heard from the inside and laughter echoes outward. Iris enters through the massive dragon sized doors with surprising ease and you and Sapphire follow. Inside there are men and women chattin, dancing, and all enjoying themselves. A huge bar sits in the middle of the room and a man is tending to his guests with a large green dragon asleep behind him. The three of you walk up to the counter and Iris asks,
         "Excuse me, but do you have any rooms available" the man turns and looks at the three of you and smiles.
         "Of course, we have the best rooms suited for dragons and their companions." he says, Iris throws some money on the table and says,
         "We'll take one."
         "Great Drake here will show you the way." he turns around and faces the dragon and yells, "Drake! Come on get up we've got guests." Drake lazily raises his head,
         "Oh great! Come on follow me!" he says, instantly perking up. Drake jumps over the counter, somehow avoiding all the tables and steps over guests as he walks over to you. "This way, and watch your step." he says as he continues stepping over the guests who seem used to this. You follow him and he opens a door revealing a huge room with a human bed and huge blanket nests for dragons. "Enjoy!" he says as he exits the room, you dash over to one of the nests in a blur of red scales,
         "Called it!" you yell, Iris walks over and flops in bed, Sapphire walks camly over to her bed and lays down. After a while all three of you are asleep and you are snoring rather loudly. Out in the lounge a man dressed in black with his hood up watches as you enter your room.
         "They're making good progress, I still must make sure that Xard doesn't interfere here. They'll be safe here though for tonight." he says to himself, Drake then spots the man, runs over to him, and lays down next to him,
         "Drax!" he says
         "Hey Drake, it's been a while, you watching out for my friend over there?" Drax says, motioning to the man at the bar.
         "Yeeeaaah..." he says
         "You haven't been pranking him, have you?"
         "What me? Never!" he says sarcastically.
1411.title: The Western Kingdom

choices: A group of hooded figures attack you
Iris drinks from the fountain without any issue
14111.content:
You wake to sunlight filtering though the window. You raise you head and look around to see that Iris and Sapphire are not there. You get a little worried and jump up out of the nest. You dash out to the bar area and see Iris sitting at a table with Sapphire laying next to her. You sigh in relief and walk over to them and carefully sit down.
         "Don't scare me like that! I thought you had run out on your own." you tell them,
         "Relax, we just came out here to have some breakfast." Sapphire responds and you see the empty plates in front of them. Drax then walks by with a large platter of meat in his teeth and sets it down in front of you.
         "There you are!" he says,
         "Do we have enough for all this?" you ask Iris
         "Don't worry the room comes with a free breakfast." Drake responds, and with that you begin to dig in.
         "Drake, do you happen to know where the town fountain is?" Iris asks,
         "Well that would be right in the town center, you just head out, take a right and follow the street until you reach it." Drake responds,
         "Alright, thanks again Drake."
         "No problem, glad I could help." Drake says as he walks away. Iris then turns to the two of you and says,
         "We'll head over there the second Blaze finishes eating." you guzzle down the last piece of meat just as she finishes talking.
         "Done!" you shout,
         "Fast as always." Sapphire says as she looks at Iris but she then realises that the two of you have already dashed out the door. "Always on the move." she says as she stands and runs after the two of you. You and Iris began to approach the fountain and so you slow to a halt. The smell of the sea is in the air and you can feel the sun beating down on your scales. The waves crash in the distance and seagulls cry over head. Sapphire finally catches up to you two, "We shouldn't be dashing around everywhere, I don't want us to get separated."
         "But you're just so slow." you smart-off to her. Her only response is a glare and you laugh at the look on her face. Iris moves up to drink from the fountain
14111.title: Morning

info.brief_description: They were warned not to delve too deep, they didn't listen.
info.description:
Welcome warrior. You have come to a very dire time in the land of Calbrix. The four kingdoms here live separate of each other in the four dominions: Krix, the largest and most populated kingdom in the mountains to the north. Coran, the mining city in the southern mountains. Seafare, the western kingdom located by the sea. And Dram, the rural kingdom located in the eastern forest. In the middle of the four kingdoms is a tall mountain surrounded by woodlands. On top of the mountain is a temple of the best magic users in the country. Humans alone cannot use magic however, they need a dragon to be with them in order to use magic. Dragons populate all over the country and are at peace with humans. Dragons are intelligent creatures and can speak as well, although they don't often interact directly with humans other than those at the temple. Dragons are not the only magical creatures, but they are the only ones who's magic humans can use. Humans can only channel magic, not generate it, dragons generate magic but they cannot channel it into use. So dragons and humans in the temple train together and practice using their magic. Dragons can allow humans to tap into their magic and humans then can channel that magic into spells. Humans and dragons don't bond, but a human and a dragon often pick someone who they like and stay with each other.
         Our story begins in the southern kingdom of Coran where something sinister has been released. The greed of the king was too great and he forced his men to dig too deep. Within the ground they unleashed the Demon King, Draven. The Demon King brought forth his army and laid waste to the southern kingdom and attempted to do the same to the rest of the land. However, the Demon was sealed away by a child at the age of 13 and a dragon forever... or so it was thought. The Demon is rising again and only a teen with the same blood of the past hero can stop him for good. While the country itself isn't aware of this crisis, the magic users are. One girl at the age of 15 has been chosen to save the world. Now enter the story and decide on the following roles.

Iris- The chosen one. She can be a little naive from time to time, but she never backs down from a fight and is extremely loyal to those she loves.

Sapphire- The blue she-dragon chosen to help Iris. Saphire is rather light most of the time but has a serious side as well. She is not to trusting of strangers and can be a little up-tight. Like Iris she is brave and loyal and is always willing to help. Saphire and Iris have known each other since they were little and always have each other's backs.

Magnius- A man at the age of 24. He is a brave and strong warrior but his dark and mysterious behavior puts Saphire on edge. He carries a massive two handed sword and the weight of a past that he refuses to talk about on his back. He doesn't say much and has no obvious care for humor and the only person who can ever get through to him is Iris. He doesn't talk much to anyone else unless he has to.

Blaze- Saphire's older brother. He is colored red and can be a bit of a comedian sometimes. He is brave, noble, and believes in always doing what's right.

This story follows a basic plot, so please stick to it. The chosen one (Iris) must travel to the springs in the four different cities and drink from each of them to gain the power to defeat Draven. She starts from the temple in the center with Saphire, then meets the other characters along the way. Feel free to travel to the cities in any order you'd like just as long as you go to Coran last. Coran has also been abandoned ever since Draven broke out and was sealed away. Now for some rules;
#1- No killing my characters
#2- You MAY add your own characters, in fact I encourage you to
#3- No sexual content at all!
#4- No evil dragons, other dragon characters can be introduced, but none may be evil
#5- Dragons are intelligent and can speak so keep it that way
#6- Follow the basic plot I have set up (see above) but feel free to add your own twists
#7- No foul language, any chapters containing F-bombs or S-bombs will be deleted, I reserve the right to edit out any foul language if I feel it nessasary
#8- Keep in the right tense and keep good spelling, I will edit chapters that break this rule, not delete them
#9- Have fun and be creative

Now go and save the world from darkness!
